meaning: n./adj. 平原；简朴的；明白的
example: Once there were seventy million buffalo roaming in the great plains
The atmosphere is thin on the plateau
Oasis symbolizes a hope in desert areas
There are people in almost every habitable part of this globe
In the northern hemisphere, you can hardly see the Magellanic Clouds
The equator is an imaginary line around the middle of the earth

meaning: adj./n. 北极的；极冷的；北极地区；北极
example: The polar bears' habitat is the icy waters of the Arctic

meaning: adj./n. 南极的；南极地区；南极洲
example: Because of the extreme cold, the environment in the Antarctic is uniquely fragile

meaning: n. （地）极；截然相反的两极之一
example: English is spoken from pole to pole

meaning: adj. 极地的；近极地的；对立的
example: In these polar regions, the balance of nature has already been disrupted
The earth's axis is the line between the North and the South Poles
Relations between the two countries have deteriorated sharply in recent weeks
Grief aggravated her illness

meaning: v. 降解；降低...身份；使恶化；使退化
example: A dishonest action like that will degrade you
The anti-virus software should often be upgraded
The waves erode the rocks on the shore

meaning: adj./n. 地中海的；地中海地区的；地中海；地中海地区
example: This dish is a cross between Asian and Mediterranean food
The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel

meaning: adj./n. 平静的；平和的；太平洋的；太平洋
example: What a beautiful and pacific place this is
These creatures live in the depth of the Pacific Ocean

meaning: adj./n. 海洋的；海生的；海事的/水兵
example: It is true that a lot of people like marine plants as their food
Navigation is a game for brave people
The gulf extends northward
They walked along the beach, talking and laughing
He is going to live by the coast for the sake of his health
His ship pulled in to the shore at midnight
The gravitational attraction between the moon and the earth causes tides

meaning: n. 水流；潮流；电流；气流
example: He was swept away by the current
Before we drink at a brook, it is good to know its source

meaning: n./v. 小河；溪；流；流动；流出
example: On either bank of the stream stand rows of willow trees
I have heard from reliable sources that the company is in trouble

meaning: adj. 浅的；肤浅的；浅薄的
example: The sea is shallow here
Superficial scratches can be easily removed

meaning: adj. 平躺的；扁平的；单调的
example: In flat open country, there is plenty of grass for the cattle to feed on

meaning: adj. 光滑的；平稳的；流畅的
example: The process of negotiation was not entirely smooth
You'd better give us a rough idea of your price
We walked across the fields on the sandy path
The ground in this part of the country is poor and stony
In some places, the cliff is almost vertical and too dangerous to climb
A long steep path leads to a tea house with a grand view of the sea

meaning: n./adj./v. 平行线；相似之处/平行的/与...相似；比得上
example: There are few parallels between American football and European football
The only access to the garden is by a narrow path at the side of the house
Oceania is a separate landmass, but it is separated from Asia by very shallow water
Hawaii and Alaska are not on the mainland of the United States
His house is located on the tip of the peninsula

meaning: n. 气候；风气，思潮，环境
example: The current political climate in that country is favorable for foreign investment
In warm weather, you should wear clothing that is cool and comfortable
Nowadays few people like to study meteorology
The weather is mild today. It is neither hot nor cold
The workers are installing a heating system

meaning: adj./v. 适度的；温和的；中等的/使缓和
example: The wind was strong all day, but it moderated in the evening
The blood of a warm-blooded animal remains around the same temperature both on warm and cold days
The thermal energy has become more and more important
He lives in the tropics

meaning: adj. 干燥的；干旱的；枯燥的
example: It is difficult to grow food in arid dessert areas
His eyes were moist with tears
The damp match won't strike
The milk powder has lumped together because my home is so humid

meaning: adj. 下雪多的；被雪覆盖的
example: The snowy weather lasted the whole time we were there
Sweet potatoes decayed after the frost
